Translation of 楚竹書・成王為城濮之行(en) into English.

p.seg: King Cheng (of Chu) made an inspection tour in Cheng Pu
The king had Zi Wen instruct Zi Yu
Zi Wen lined up the army at X
at the end of the day
he did not punish a single man.
Zi Yu lined up the army
and set it out in Kui (?)
at the end of three days
he decapitated three men.
The whole state congratulated Zi Wen
for his good way of managing the army.
When the king returned
he was hosted by Zi Wen
Zi Wen was very happy (about it).
The whole state so (celebrated by) drinking wine.
Wei Bo Ying was still young (?)
and [yet, even though his junior position demanded that he pay special respect, he] was slow in holding the boat-shaped cup to drink wine
toasting to Zi Wen
Zi Wen raised ??
Bo Ying said:
Gu Wutu is [...]
The elders and the king of the state of Chu excused my guilt (=modest words: gave me responsability even though I didn't deserve it)
and because Zi Yu did not yet have (enough) training
The ruler ordered me to line up the army at X
at the end of the day
I did not punish a single man.
While Zi Yu set it (=the army) out in Kui (?)
and at the end of three days
he decapitated three men.
The king was my guest
The whole state congratulated me
(and yet by) you [...] alone I have not been given food (?) [=you did not pay respect to me]
this means to countervene (the will of) Heaven
and disregarding the heart-mind of an old man (=slighting me).
Bo Ying said:
"The ruler said that Zi Yu was not yet trained
and since he has already brought the army to defeat
While you, sir, are one of the elders of the state of Chu,
to rejoice in your good (acts) and not to bring under control
Zi Yu's army's [...] [amounts to commend a failure of leadership].
The king ordered to teach him.
The lord in one day did not [...]
[...] words!
Lord-like!
